OWASP Top 10 for LLMs - LLM and Gen AI Data Security Best Practices Guide 1.0

This document, titled 'OWASP Top 10 for LLMs - LLM and Gen AI Data Security Best Practices Guide 1.0', provides a foundational resource focused on securing Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI (Gen AI) systems. It’s a guide created by the Open Web Application Security Project (OWASP), a non-profit organization dedicated to improving the security of software. The primary goal is to offer practical best practices for organizations deploying and utilizing LLMs and Gen AI, addressing the unique security challenges associated with these rapidly evolving technologies. The document emphasizes a proactive approach to security, encouraging users to understand the potential risks and implement appropriate safeguards. It’s crucial to note that this guide is intended for informational purposes only and does not constitute legal advice. The core of the document centers around the OWASP Top 10, a widely recognized framework for web application security, adapted and applied to the specific vulnerabilities and risks present in LLMs and Gen AI. The guide outlines ten critical areas of concern, including data security, model security, prompt injection, and responsible AI development. It provides recommendations for mitigating these risks, covering aspects such as data governance, access control, model monitoring, and user authentication. The license for this document is Creative Commons, CC BY-SA 4.0, which grants users the freedom to share, adapt, and build upon the material, provided they adhere to the attribution and share-alike terms. This means that anyone who uses or modifies the guide must give credit to OWASP, provide a link to the license, and if they make changes, distribute their contributions under the same license. The document begins with acknowledgements and an audience section, followed by an introduction that sets the stage for the subsequent best practices. The table of contents indicates a structured approach to presenting the information, likely detailing the ten OWASP Top 10 recommendations for LLM and Gen AI data security.
